data.title: Take Five With Sonoma International Live and Virtual Film Festival
data.meta_description: Review the answers about SIFF by the people who answered the five top questions according to their thoughts.
data.text:
What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

Gosh. It is almost impossible to choose one. Going with the first movie that popped into my head it would be the 1983 version of Jane Eyre with Timothy Dalton. My mom and I used to have classic movie nights ever Friday and this movie really struck me. The love story and push and pull of these two protagonists awoke something in me I hadn’t experienced before.. All of my favorite movies are directly connected to a time in my life and connection made during that film. An a-ha moment of sorts.

What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

Sooo many...The Sound of Music-I attended with my family-we dressed up and it was a hard lesson on how you see people and they may not have the same freedoms you do in the world...And who doesn't love Julie Andrews!

What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

The Godfather - Its themes of succession and family transcend the gangster genre and make the story so relatable. I'm working on a Netflix series about the mob right now, and it's amazing how many people think the Corleone family is real.

What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

The Shawshank Redemption because it has everything that, in my opinion, makes it watchable over and over and over. The friendship formed between the characters played by Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins is one of the best ever!

What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

The Breakfast Club - It is a movie I can watch endlessly with one of the best written group of characters ever. It's always parodied with the famous dancing scene, but people often forget about long group chat the teenagers have, the moments of real connection and humour, where every problem feels real and experienced. It's a masterpiece and undoubtedly a pop culture tentpole.

What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

The Graduate. It was kind of a dream team with Mike Nichols direction and the screenplay by Buck Henry and Calder Willingham; plus Dustin Hoffman is beyond brilliant in this film, as is the great Anne Bancroft. And I still recite the single, perfect line that encapsulates the lunacy of that era: "There's a great future in plastics. Think about it. Will you think about it?"

What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

Please can I have two?? Babette's Feast and Some Like It Hot. The Danish film Babette's Feast was such a beautiful portrayal of the transformational power of both food and art, and Some Like It Hot is just a classic; genius and iconic, hilarious and riveting to me.

What's your go to movie snack?

Almond Magnum ice creams ... but that's just my go to far too much all the time snack.Almond Magnum ice creams ... but that's just my go to far too much all the time snack.

What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

Impossible to say, but my favorite movie of 2020 was DA FIVE BLOODS because it offered a unique/new perspective on a topic that we are familiar with. Also utilized music to drive a story in an incredible way.

What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

After decades of film programming, I find this question challenging as I have a fave film for every season, mood, fancy... so hard to narrow down. If I have to throw just one title out, I think I would say 'My Life As A Dog' directed by Lasse Hallestrom.

What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

Predator (1987); I had no choice in this film, it chose me. I will always vividly remember watching this film for the first time on the floor of my childhood home on the television (so it probably even had scenes edited out), riveted, immersed in a world I had never seen before. Since then, I always wanted to be associated with film.

What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

Do I have to pick one? When We Were Kings - because... Ali, Foreman, James Brown, a Rumble in the Jungle... it made me dream; The Fog of War - because Errol Morris, Robert MacNamara, Philip Glass... it made me understand; Exit Through the Gift Shop - because... it made me curious; Monsoon Wedding... because Mira Nair, color, it made me marvel; Goodfellas - because... Scorsese, DeNiro, Pesce, Ray Liotta in the performance of a lifetime... it made me want more; Annie Hall - because... Woody Allen at his very best... it made me feel Jewish and validated; Silence of the Lambs - because Demme, Hopkins, Foster... it made me squirm; Exorcist - because Linda Blair... it kept me up at night; Blazing Saddles - because ... MEL BROOKS ... it made me laugh; Cinema Paradiso - because... it made me care; Slum Dog Millionaire - because damn that's good! I'll stop there.

What's your favorite movie of all time and why?

I have too many favorites but one that has stuck with me is Guillermo del Toro's Pan's Labyrinth (2006). A masterpiece infused with fantasy and at the same uncovering politics and history that has been buried and forgotten by the current generation.
